intro: Mapania aschersoniana, commonly known as the Ascherson's mapania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and palmately lobed leaves. It is often found in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
